Sentencas: Hydrogen fuel cells and electrolyzers operating below 600 degrees C, ideally below 400 degrees C, are essential components in the clean energy transition.
Titulo: In Situ Nanoscale Dynamics Imaging in a Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide for Protonic Ceramic Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Yttrium-doped barium zirconate BaZr0.8Y0.2O3-d (BZY) has attracted a lot of attention as a proton-conducting solid oxide for electrochemical devices due to its high chemical stability and proton conductivity in the desired temperature range.
Titulo: In Situ Nanoscale Dynamics Imaging in a Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide for Protonic Ceramic Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Grain interfaces and topological defects modulate bulk proton conductivity and hydration, especially at low temperatures.
Titulo: In Situ Nanoscale Dynamics Imaging in a Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide for Protonic Ceramic Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Therefore, understanding the nanoscale crystal structure dynamics in situ is crucial to achieving high proton transport, material stability, and extending the operating range of proton-conducting solid oxides.
Titulo: In Situ Nanoscale Dynamics Imaging in a Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide for Protonic Ceramic Fuel Cells

Sentencas: Here, Bragg coherent X-ray diffractive imaging is applied to investigate in situ and in 3D nanoscale dynamics in BZY during hydration over 40 h at 200 degrees C, in the low-temperature range.
Titulo: In Situ Nanoscale Dynamics Imaging in a Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide for Protonic Ceramic Fuel Cells

Sentencas: An unexpected activity of topological defects and subsequent cracking is found on a nanoscale covered by the macroscale stability.
Titulo: In Situ Nanoscale Dynamics Imaging in a Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide for Protonic Ceramic Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The rearrangements in structure correlate with emergent regions of different lattice constants, suggesting heterogeneous hydration.
Titulo: In Situ Nanoscale Dynamics Imaging in a Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide for Protonic Ceramic Fuel Cells

Sentencas: The results highlight the extent and impact of nanoscale processes in proton-conducting solid oxides, informing future development of low-temperature protonic ceramic electrochemical cells.
Titulo: In Situ Nanoscale Dynamics Imaging in a Proton-Conducting Solid Oxide for Protonic Ceramic Fuel Cells
